results.title: Lisa Curry's pregnancy workout
results.creator_credit: Jeff Hogan, Leigh Gower and Carol Lloyd Corporate Theatre
results.brief_description: The golden girl of Australian swimming, Lisa Curry presents this personal pregnancy workout program - a professionally planned and directed series of aerobic-styled exercises you can do each day in the privacy of your own home. Filmed in the Sunshine Coast waterfront home Lisa shares with husband, Grant Kenny - surfing “iron man” and Olympic canoeist -“Lisa Curry’s pregnancy workout” covers a wide range of pregnancy health and fitness topics of assistance to all expectant parents.

results.title: The Great Impressionists
results.creator_credit: Steve Isaac, Australian National Gallery and Capital 7 Canberra
results.brief_description: The Great Impressionists exhibition at the Australian National Gallery in 1984 featured works of leading Impressionists such as Manet, Degas, Renoir, Monet, Cezanne, Van Gogh, Pissaro, Gauguin and Seurat. The script, explaining the priceless collection on loan from the Courtauld Institute in London, was written by the Gallery’s Senior Curator of Education, Terence Measham with the express desire to delight and entertain as well as inform.

results.title: Jilted
results.creator_credit: Bill Bennett, Jenny Day and Mermaid Beach Productions
results.brief_description: Set around a tropical island resort where Al works trying to escape his past, and where Harriet is running from a failed marriage. Both hurt in the past, they become involved - until disturbed by the arrival of another woman. Cast includes Richard Moir, Jennifer Cluff, Steve Jacobs, Tina Bursill and Helen Mutkins.

results.title: Babar. Race to the Moon; No Place Like Home
results.creator_credit: Laura Shepherd, Clive A Smith, Michael Hirsh, Patrick Loubert, Clifford Ross Co and Nelvana
results.brief_description: More trouble with Lord Rataxes awaits King Babar in these two adventures in Elephant land: “Race to the Moon” - Babar’s hopes of rebuilding an old theatre are jeopardised when all his subjects get caught up in trying to build a rocket ship to beat Lord Rataxes to the moon. “No Place Like Home” - Babar lets a young circus boy live in the palace. But when the lad wants to return to his circus home, he discovers that it might be too late, because the circus has been captured by Lord Rataxes. Based on the picture books by Jean and Laurent de Brunhoff.

results.title: Crocodile Dundee II
results.creator_credit: John Cornell, Jane Scott and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Begins in New York where Dundee now lives with his journalist girlfriend. In order to escape the pursuit of an international drug ring who have murdered her former husband, Dundee and his girlfriend return to the Australian outback where Dundee is well prepared to confront them.

results.title: The Delinquents
results.creator_credit: Chris Thomson, Alex Cutler, Mike Wilcox, Silver Lining and Village Roadshow Pictures
results.brief_description: Love story about two teenagers in 1950’s Australia whose passion and love for each other breaks not only the rules set down by their parents but also by society. Based on the novel of the same name by Criena Rohan. Stars Kylie Minogue and Charlie Schlatter with Bruno Lawrence, Todd Boyce, Desiree Smith, Melissa Jaffer, Angela Punch-McGregor.

results.title: End play
results.brief_description: Two brothers involve themselves in a series of murders and coverups involving innocent hitchhikers. Stars George Mallaby and John Waters.

results.title: Archer
results.creator_credit: Denny Lawrence, Maya Iceton, Coote and Carroll and Roadshow Television
results.brief_description: Brett Climo plays Dave Power, a young and ambitious caretaker of a racehorse named Archer. In order to get Archer to the 1861 Melbourne Cup, where the horse must compete. Power takes him on a 600-mile outback odyssey, fraught with excitment and peril. The horse then wins the race. Also features 18 year old Nicole Kidman in a crucial role Based on a true story of perhaps Australia’s greatest racehorse

results.title: Sunstruck
results.creator_credit: James Gilbert, Jack Neary, James Grafton and Immigrant (AU)
results.brief_description: After responding to a New South Wales government advertisement designed to attract teachers from Britain, a shy teacher from Wales is assigned to a one-teacher school in the isolated bush town of Kookaburra Springs. Initially he has problems adjusting to his new life as he struggles to gain respect from his students. Despite resistance he forms a school choir, which travels Sydney to participate in a singing competition. The trip is a success and on their return to Kookaburra Springs he decides to stay on in the town and marry. Primarily a vehicle for British singer and comedian Harry Secombe, the film was shot on location near the New South Wales town of Parkes with a budget of under $400,000. Cast also includes Maggie Fitzgibbon, John Meillon, Peter Whittle, Dawn Lake, Bobby Limb.

results.title: The Winds of Jarrah
results.creator_credit: Marj Pearson, Mark Egerton and Film Corporation of Western Australia
results.brief_description: Based on a Harlequin/Mills and Boon novel “The house in the timberwoods” by Joyce Dingwell. Set in Australia in 1946, it is the story of an English governess employed by the wealthy boss of a timber empire. He and his three children harbour a deep mistrust of women and she is befriended by one of the many returned servicemen in the timberlands. Stars Terence Donovan and Susan Lyons, supported by Harold Hopkins, Steve Bisley and Martin Vaughan.
